Welcome to Cognitive State Machine’s documentation!¶

class statemachine.StateMachine(name)¶

The state machine class will be used to hold states, direct inputs, and provide outputs.

add_output()¶

Prompt user for output data. Stores output object into state machine.

add_state()¶

Prompts user for state data. Creates a state and stores state object in state machine.

add_transition()¶

Adds next state data into corresponding transition table starting state’s index.

assign_state(cs, ps, ce)¶

Assign state machine variables to updated states and updated event.

Parameters:
  • cs – A state object indicating the current state of the state machine.
  • ps – A state object indicating the previous state of the machine.
  • ce – An event object indicating the event the state machine just received.
display_events()¶

Display all possible events the state machine could receive.

display_machine()¶

Display the current status of the state machine.

display_outputs()¶

Display all output possibilities for the state machine.

display_states()¶

Display list of states.

edit_transition()¶

Replaces next state data into corresponding transition table starting state’s index.

get_event_index(event)¶

Return an integer that corresponds to the state machine event list when given an event object, data specific to a certain event, or a name specific to a certain event.

Parameters:event – Either an event object, an integer, or a string indicating which event we are searching for in self.events.
get_output_index(output)¶

Return an integer that corresponds to the state machine output list when given an output object, ata specific to a certain output, or a name specific to a certain output.

Parameters:output – Either an output object, an integer, or a string indicating which output we are searching for in self.outputs.
get_state_index(state)¶

Return an integer that corresponds to the state machine state list when given a state object, data specific to a certain state, or a name specific to a certain state.

Parameters:state – Either a state object, an integer, or a string indicating which event we are searching for in self.states.
input_event()¶

Prompts user for event input. Function will create event object and pass it into update_state.

load()¶

Loads a state machine from a text file.

name_to_event(name)¶

Return event object in self.events with event name equal to the parameter ‘name’.

Parameters:name – A string indicating the name of the event being searched for in self.events.
name_to_state(name)¶

Return state object in self.states with state name equal to the parameter ‘name’.

Parameters:name – A string indicating the name of the state being searched for in self.states.
reset_machine()¶

Resets everything in the state machine to default values.

reset_transition_table()¶

Reset the transition table to default values, e.g. -1

reset_transition_table2(num_states, num_events)¶

Reset the transition table to default values, e.g. -1

Parameters:
  • num_states – An integer indicating the number of state objects that are in the self.states list
  • num_events – An integer indicating the number of event objects that are in the self.events list
save()¶

Saves the current state machine along with child data.

show_output_table()¶

Display output table.

show_transition_table()¶

Display transition table.

update_output_table()¶

Update the size of the output table based on the size of self.states and self.events after adding a new state or event.

update_state(event)¶

Uses current state and new event to index the state machine transitions table, assign the new state to the state machine, and display/send the corresponding output data to the guidance system.

Parameters:event – An event object indicating what event the state machine received form the vision system.
update_transition_table()¶

Update the size of the transition table based on the size of self.states and self.events sizes after adding a new state or event.

state.py¶

The module that holds all of the attributes for a state.

class state.State(data, name)¶

The state class will be used to represent states in a state machine.

get_data()¶

Returns the data representation of a state object.

get_state()¶

Displays local descriptions indexed by local data.

show_descriptions()¶

Displays the default descriptions.

event.py¶

The module that holds all of the attributes for an event.

class event.Event(data, name)¶

The event class will be used to represent inputs received from the vision system.

get_data()¶

Returns the data representation of an event object.

get_event()¶

Displays local descriptions indexed by local data.

set_data(new_data)¶

Sets the local event data.

Parameters:new_data – A list of integers indicating the new representation for an event.
show_descriptions()¶

Displays the default descriptions.

output.py¶

The module that holds all of the attributes for an output.

class output.Output(data, name)¶

The output class will be used to represent output sent to the motion controller.

get_data()¶

Returns the data representation of an output object.

get_name()¶

Returns the name of an output object.

get_output()¶

Displays local descriptions indexed by local data.

set_data(new_data)¶

Sets the local output data.

Parameters:new_data – A list of integers indicating the new representation for a state.
show_descriptions()¶

Displays the default descriptions.
